title: What is Amazon's new 'Add to Delivery' feature? How it works
text:
Need to make a last-minute addition to your latest  Amazon Prime order ? Well, you're in luck because there's a new way to make changes on the  Amazon  app.

The e-commerce giant has launched a new feature on its app called  "Add to Delivery,"  a button that allows customers to add additional items to a delivery for an order that has already been placed.

The option is available exclusively to Prime members. Not all items are eligible for "Add to Delivery" — a blue button will appear alongside the existing "Add to cart" option if items qualify.

"If we can still add to your delivery that’s arriving later today or tomorrow, you’ll see the Add to Delivery option as you shop, and with one tap you’ll be done," Amazon said in a  news release.

The new "Add to Delivery" feature is only available on the Amazon Shopping mobile app or  Amazon.com  on mobile devices.

Eligible items will have a blue "Add to Delivery" button on the product's details page. If tapped, the item will be added automatically to an upcoming delivery. There is an "undo" option right away if the button was tapped erroneously.

It's not necessary to go through checkout again to use the "Add to Delivery" option. There are also no additional shipping costs associated with using the feature.

The "Add to Delivery" option is only available for Amazon Prime members in the United States.

Prime is available for $14.99/month or $139/year, with a 30-day free trial for eligible customers. Find more information at  amazon.com/prime .

Melina Khan is a national trending reporter for USA TODAY. She can be reached at  melina.khan@usatoday.com .
